13  package org.cesecore.certificates.ocsp.cache;
14  
15  import java.math.BigInteger;
16  import java.security.cert.CertificateEncodingException;
17  import java.security.cert.X509Certificate;
18  import java.util.ArrayList;
19  import java.util.Collection;
20  import java.util.HashMap;
21  import java.util.List;
22  import java.util.Map;
23  import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
24  
25  import org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils;
26  import org.apache.log4j.Logger;
27  import org.bouncycastle.asn1.nist.NISTObjectIdentifiers;
28  import org.bouncycastle.asn1.oiw.OIWObjectIdentifiers;
29  import org.bouncycastle.asn1.x509.AlgorithmIdentifier;
30  import org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.CertificateID;
31  import org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.OCSPException;
32  import org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.jcajce.JcaCertificateID;
33  import org.bouncycastle.operator.OperatorCreationException;
34  import org.bouncycastle.operator.bc.BcDigestCalculatorProvider;
35  import org.cesecore.certificates.ocsp.exception.OcspFailureException;
36  import org.cesecore.util.CertTools;
37  
38  /**
39   * Hold information needed to create OCSP responses without database lookups.
40   * 
41   * @version $Id: OcspSigningCache.java 28643 2018-04-06 08:53:57Z samuellb $
42   */
43  public enum OcspSigningCache {
44      INSTANCE;
45      
46      private Map<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry> cache = new HashMap<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry>();
47      private Map<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry> staging = new HashMap<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry>();
48      private OcspSigningCacheEntry defaultResponderCacheEntry = null;
49      private final ReentrantLock lock = new ReentrantLock(false);
50      private final static Logger log = Logger.getLogger(OcspSigningCache.class);
51      /** Flag to detect and log non-existence of a default responder once. */
52      private boolean logDefaultHasRunOnce = false;
53  
54      public OcspSigningCacheEntry getEntry(final CertificateID certID) {
55          return cache.get(getCacheIdFromCertificateID(certID));
56      }
57  
58      /**
59       * 
60       * @return the entry corresponding to the default responder, or null if it wasn't found.
61       */
62      public OcspSigningCacheEntry getDefaultEntry() {
63          return defaultResponderCacheEntry;
64      }
65  
66      /** WARNING: This method potentially exports references to CAs private keys! 
67       * @return entries*/
68      public Collection<OcspSigningCacheEntry> getEntries() {
69          return cache.values();
70      }
71  
72      public void stagingStart() {
73          lock.lock();
74          staging = new HashMap<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry>();
75      }
76  
77      public void stagingAdd(OcspSigningCacheEntry ocspSigningCacheEntry) {
78          List<CertificateID> certIDs = ocspSigningCacheEntry.getCertificateID();
79          for (CertificateID certID : certIDs) {
80              staging.put(getCacheIdFromCertificateID(certID), ocspSigningCacheEntry);            
81          }
82      }
83  
84      public void stagingCommit(final String defaultResponderSubjectDn) {
85          OcspSigningCacheEntry defaultResponderCacheEntry = null;
86          for (final OcspSigningCacheEntry entry : staging.values()) {
87              if (entry.getOcspSigningCertificate() != null) {
88                  final X509Certificate signingCertificate = entry.getOcspSigningCertificate();
89                  if (CertTools.getIssuerDN(signingCertificate).equals(defaultResponderSubjectDn)) {
90                      defaultResponderCacheEntry = entry;
91                      break;
92                  }
93              } else if (entry.getCaCertificateChain() != null && !entry.getCaCertificateChain().isEmpty()) {
94                  final X509Certificate signingCertificate = entry.getCaCertificateChain().get(0);
95                  if (CertTools.getSubjectDN(signingCertificate).equals(defaultResponderSubjectDn)) {
96                      defaultResponderCacheEntry = entry;
97                      break;
98                  }
99              }
100         }
101         //Lastly, walk through the list of entries and replace all placeholders with the default responder
102         Map<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry> modifiedEntries = new HashMap<Integer, OcspSigningCacheEntry>();
103         List<Integer> removedEntries = new ArrayList<Integer>();
104         for (Integer key : staging.keySet()) {
105             OcspSigningCacheEntry entry = staging.get(key);
106             //If entry has been created without a private key, replace it with the default responder.
107             if (entry.isPlaceholder()) {
108                 if (defaultResponderCacheEntry != null) {
109                     entry = new OcspSigningCacheEntry(entry.getIssuerCaCertificate(), entry.getIssuerCaCertificateStatus(),
110                             defaultResponderCacheEntry.getCaCertificateChain(), defaultResponderCacheEntry.getOcspSigningCertificate(),
111                             defaultResponderCacheEntry.getPrivateKey(), defaultResponderCacheEntry.getSignatureProviderName(),
112                             defaultResponderCacheEntry.getOcspKeyBinding(), defaultResponderCacheEntry.getResponderIdType());
113                     modifiedEntries.put(key, entry);
114                 } else {
115                     //If no default responder is defined, remove placeholder. 
116                     removedEntries.add(key);
117                 }
118             }
119         }
120         staging.putAll(modifiedEntries);
121         for (Integer removedKey : removedEntries) {
122             staging.remove(removedKey);
123         }
124         logDefaultResponderChanges(this.defaultResponderCacheEntry, defaultResponderCacheEntry, defaultResponderSubjectDn);
125         cache = staging;
126         this.defaultResponderCacheEntry = defaultResponderCacheEntry;
127         if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
128             log.debug("Committing the following to OCSP cache:");
129             for (final Integer key : staging.keySet()) {
130                 final OcspSigningCacheEntry entry = staging.get(key);
131                 log.debug(" KeyBindingId: " + key + ", SubjectDN '" + CertTools.getSubjectDN(entry.getFullCertificateChain().get(0))
132                         + "', IssuerDN '" + CertTools.getIssuerDN(entry.getFullCertificateChain().get(0)) + "', SerialNumber "
133                         + entry.getFullCertificateChain().get(0).getSerialNumber().toString() + "/"
134                         + entry.getFullCertificateChain().get(0).getSerialNumber().toString(16));
135                 if (entry.getOcspKeyBinding() != null) {
136                     log.debug("   keyPairAlias: " + entry.getOcspKeyBinding().getKeyPairAlias());
137                 }
138             }
139         }
140     }
141 
142     public void stagingRelease() {
143         lock.unlock();
144     }
145 
146     /** Log any change in default responder 
147      * @param currentEntry current entry
148      * @param stagedEntry  staged entry
149      * @param defaultResponderSubjectDn boolean */
150     private void logDefaultResponderChanges(final OcspSigningCacheEntrygCacheEntry.html#OcspSigningCacheEntry">OcspSigningCacheEntry currentEntry, final OcspSigningCacheEntry stagedEntry, final String defaultResponderSubjectDn) {
151         String msg = null;
152         if (stagedEntry==null && (currentEntry!=null || !logDefaultHasRunOnce)) {
153             // No default responder after staging. Did we loose it or is it the first time we run this check?
154             if (StringUtils.isEmpty(defaultResponderSubjectDn)) {
155                 msg = "No default responder was defined.";
156             } else {
157                 msg = "The default OCSP responder with subject '" + defaultResponderSubjectDn + "' was not found.";
158             }
159             msg += " OCSP requests for certificates issued by unknown CAs will return \"unauthorized\" as per RFC6960, Section 2.3";
160         } else if (stagedEntry!=null && currentEntry==null) {
161             // We gained a default responder.
162             if (stagedEntry.isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate()) {
163                 msg = "Setting keybinding with ID" + stagedEntry.getOcspKeyBinding().getId() + " and DN " + defaultResponderSubjectDn
164                         + " as default OCSP responder.";
165             } else {
166                 msg = "Setting CA with DN " + defaultResponderSubjectDn + " as default OCSP responder.";
167             }
168         } else if (stagedEntry!=null && currentEntry!=null) {
169             // We have a default responder both before and after. Did it change in any way?
170             if (stagedEntry.isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate()!=currentEntry.isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate()
171                     || !CertTools.getSubjectDN(stagedEntry.getIssuerCaCertificate()).equals(CertTools.getSubjectDN(currentEntry.getIssuerCaCertificate()))) {
172                 // We switched from signing with a CA to OcspKeyBindinig or vice versa, or use a different default.
173                 if (stagedEntry.isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate()) {
174                     msg = "Setting keybinding with ID" + stagedEntry.getOcspKeyBinding().getId() + " and DN " + defaultResponderSubjectDn
175                             + " as default OCSP responder.";
176                 } else {
177                     msg = "Setting CA with DN " + defaultResponderSubjectDn + " as default OCSP responder.";
178                 }
179             } else if (stagedEntry.isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate()) {
180                 if (stagedEntry.getOcspKeyBinding().getId() != currentEntry.getOcspKeyBinding().getId()) {
181                     // A different OcspKeyBinding will be used to respond to requests even though the issuing CA has not changed
182                     msg = "Setting keybinding with ID" + stagedEntry.getOcspKeyBinding().getId() + " and DN " + defaultResponderSubjectDn
183                             + " as default OCSP responder.";
184                 }
185             }
186         }
187         if (msg==null) {
188             if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
189                 log.debug("No change in default responder.");
190             }
191         } else {
192             log.info(msg);
193         }
194         logDefaultHasRunOnce = true;
195     }
196 
197     /**
198      * This method will add a single cache entry to the cache. It should only be used to solve temporary cache inconsistencies.
199      * 
200      * @param ocspSigningCacheEntry the entry to add
201      */
202     public void addSingleEntry(OcspSigningCacheEntry ocspSigningCacheEntry) {
203         List<CertificateID> certIDs = ocspSigningCacheEntry.getCertificateID();
204         for (CertificateID certID : certIDs) {
205             int cacheId = getCacheIdFromCertificateID(certID);
206             lock.lock();
207             try {
208                 //Make sure that another thread didn't add the same entry while this one was waiting.
209                 if (!cache.containsKey(cacheId)) {
210                     cache.put(cacheId, ocspSigningCacheEntry);
211                 }
212             } finally {
213                 lock.unlock();
214             }
215         }
216     }
217 
218     /** @param certID ID
219      * @return a cache identifier based on the provided CertificateID. */
220     public static int getCacheIdFromCertificateID(final CertificateID certID) {
221         // Use bitwise XOR of the hashcodes for IssuerNameHash and IssuerKeyHash to produce the integer.
222         int result = new BigInteger(certID.getIssuerNameHash()).hashCode() ^ new BigInteger(certID.getIssuerKeyHash()).hashCode();
223         if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
224             log.debug("Using getIssuerNameHash " + new BigInteger(certID.getIssuerNameHash()).toString(16) + " and getIssuerKeyHash "
225                     + new BigInteger(certID.getIssuerKeyHash()).toString(16) + " to produce id " + result);
226         }
227         return result;
228     }
229 
230     /** @param certificate certificate
231      * @return the CertificateID's based on the provided certificate */
232     public static List<CertificateID> getCertificateIDFromCertificate(final X509Certificate certificate) {
233         try {
234             if (log.isTraceEnabled()) {
235                 log.trace("Building CertificateId's from certificate with subjectDN '" + CertTools.getSubjectDN(certificate) + "'.");
236             }
237             List<CertificateID> ret = new ArrayList<CertificateID>();
238             ret.add(new JcaCertificateID(new BcDigestCalculatorProvider().get(new AlgorithmIdentifier(OIWObjectIdentifiers.idSHA1)), certificate, certificate.getSerialNumber()));
239             ret.add(new JcaCertificateID(new BcDigestCalculatorProvider().get(new AlgorithmIdentifier(NISTObjectIdentifiers.id_sha256)), certificate, certificate.getSerialNumber()));
240             return ret;
241         } catch (OCSPException e) {
242             throw new OcspFailureException(e);
243         } catch (CertificateEncodingException e) {
244             throw new OcspFailureException(e);
245         } catch (OperatorCreationException e) {
246             throw new OcspFailureException(e);
247         }
248     }
249 }
